paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 p.Leu2092Profs*7 variant was found in one relative with BC.

functional_data.summary: The variant is predicted to result in a truncated protein, potentially leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family history and clinical significance.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was identified in a patient with a family history of breast cancer.
key_quotes: We detected a 12% of individuals carrying variants. These variants were located in the high-risk genes BRCA1, BRCA2, TP53, and PALB2.

tables_processed.table_caption: Pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants detected in the cancer susceptibility genes in a high-risk population

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the BRCA2 variant was successfully extracted.
